info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 9:30PM EST until further notice by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Wateree River Near Camden affecting Kershaw County. Congaree River At Columbia affecting Richland and Lexington Counties. Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Richland and Calhoun Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Richland, Calhoun and Lexington Counties. Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Marlboro and Chesterfield Counties. Saluda River At Chappells affecting Greenwood, Saluda and Newberry Counties. Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Lancaster, Fairfield and Kershaw Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wateree River at Lake Wateree. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 100.4 feet, The piers on the Wildlife Road bridge over Singleton Creek become submerged. At 102.5 feet, Roadways near Beaver Creek become flooded. At 103.0 feet, Home owners on low lying property have to move belongings out of basements or from under raised houses. Boat launch on U.S. Highway 1 at the lake closed due to flood water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 102.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 100.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 102.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 100.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 930 AM EST.
